snippet: A spate of police raids and arrested suspects showed the complexity of the challenge facing intelligence agencies and security services in confronting the expanding threat from radical jihadis.
abstract: Spate of arrests of terror suspects in Belgium, Germany and France both spotlights the difficulties European authorities face in confronting radical jihadists and their increasing willingness to act forcefully in advance to stop these potential threats.

byline.original: By ALISON SMALE and JAMES KANTER
byline.contributor: Alison Smale reported from Berlin, and James Kanter from Brussels and Verviers, Belgium. Melissa Eddy contributed reporting from Berlin, and Alan Cowell from London.

lead_paragraph: A spate of police raids and arrested suspects showed the complexity of the challenge facing intelligence agencies and security services in confronting the expanding threat from radical jihadis.

headline.main: As Europe Moves Aggressively Against Terrorism, New Challenges Emerge
headline.print_headline: As Europe Moves Aggressively Against Terrorism, New Challenges Emerge

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
